body_html:
Any progress, @suiyuan2009 ? I guess it should be pretty straightforward if you just convert the tf.SparseTensor to become a namedtuple or a dict, containing values, indices and dense_shape.
Ah actually, it doesn't seem to support dicts/namedtuples?

Directly converting to scipy.sparse.coo_matrix would be cool, actually :)

coo_matrix only seems to support 2 dimensions.

body:
Any progress, @suiyuan2009 ? I guess it should be pretty straightforward if you just convert the tf.SparseTensor to become a namedtuple or a dict, containing `values`, `indices` and `dense_shape`.
Ah actually, it doesn't seem to support dicts/namedtuples?

> Directly converting to scipy.sparse.coo_matrix would be cool, actually :)

coo_matrix only seems to support 2 dimensions.
